author: R Srikanth
text:
A windmill farm set up in Tirunelveli helps generate more than 50 per cent of electricity consumed at the mall from May-September —File Photo

Citi Centre, located in Mylapore, makes a powerful demonstration of promoting green energy.

The 4-lakh square feet mall, which has completed 10 years, meets its energy requirements through a windmill farm.

A spokesperson of the mall said three windmill generators, having a total capacity of 4.5 mega watt (MW), that have been installed in Tirunelveli meet the electricity needs of the mall.

As a result, the mall’s dependence on the electricity grid has reduced.

The windmill farm set up in 2009 helps generate more than 50 per cent of the electricity consumed at the mall during the peak months between May and September. This is also the peak season when the mall attracts a large number of visitors, added the spokesperson.

An official of the Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation (Tangedco) said the accounting system in cases where a company is located at one place and the windmill at another, involves deducting the energy consumed from the energy injected into the electricity grid and the remaining amount of energy units would have to be paid for by the consumer.
title: A city mall ‘powered’ by a windmill farm miles away
